sentence: Aiken also took aim at controversial Republican lawmakers by name, including North Carolina Rep. Madison Cawthorn, whom he called a white nationalist.
author: Kate Scanlon
title: Former American Idol contestant Clay Aiken launches second bid for Congress

sentence: ATTACK AD Also in North Carolina, Representative Madison Cawthorn came under fire from his Republican rivals over remarks at a town hall in which he criticized Zelenskiy and Ukraine.
author: David Morgan
title: Ukraine War Becomes A Cudgel In Republican Party's Internal Conflict

sentence: In 2020, political newcomer Madison Cawthorn comfortably won a GOP congressional primary runoff over Trump's pick.
author: Gary D. Robertson
title: Trump's endorsement power tested in North Carolina Senate race

sentence: The major media outlets proceeded to covered a medium-sized political rally in Johnston County with wall-to-wall live coverage approximating that of September 11th: The next morning, literally every story on the Raleigh News & Observer's website was about the Trump rally: Though reporters did fact-check? Trump's speech (which was, as usual, chock-full of gibberish), they also provided him (as well as Tedd Budd, Madison Cawthorn, Bo Hines, Dan Bishop and a litany of fellow travelers) a bonanza of free advertising.
title: Trump's North Carolina "rally" on Saturday was a total bust. Here's why.

sentence: Rep. Madison Cawthorn is favored to win the Republican primary in North Carolina's 11th Congressional District despite several run-ins with the law and fresh allegations of insider trading.

title: Rep. Madison Cawthorn holds GOP primary edge despite many unflattering headlines
